Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2007 06:05AM Rosemary44 wrote: I can never remember the name of the test they're doing today to tell you if you need chemo or not.  I would definately want that test done should the tumor not be benign. You need to ask about mammosite radiation.  The surgeon does the implant for that if you want it instead of normal radiation.   Of course we're getting ahead of ourselves here, but it's best to ask any questions you can think of, and do take notes.  My surgeon taped my entire interview with him which was good to go back and listen to.  He even gave me his home number if I couldn't reach him at the office.  Nice guy.

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2008 06:49AM Rosemary44 wrote: Adding a tsp. of cinnamon to fruit juicing helps to control the sugar highs.  Also adding a tbls of olive oil to vegetable juice in your glass will help you to absorb the vitamin K in the veggies. My vegetable juicing is usually carrots, broccoli or kale, spinach,  beet root, ginger root, and bok choy.  I switch to collard greens when I see the organic ones.  They are loaded with vitamin K.
